intro: Halimocnemis tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly flaxweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a woolly appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the family. Halimocnemis tomentosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
